questions.question_text: What tools are available to the assignee to help resolve an incident? (Choose two.)
When you activate the ITSM Roles plugin, what additional granular roles are created for the Incident application? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B & C is Correct
B + C Correct

Selected Answer: BC
correct

choices.D: Modify the choice list to include only the appropriate group types
choices.B: Add a UI action to provide an error message if the Network CAB group is selected
choices.C: Add Dictionary Override to specify the Incident group Reference Qualifier
choices.A: Add a UI action to hide the Network CAB group from the list

questions.question_text:
Your customer is complaining that Service Desk users keep accidentally assigning Incidents to the Network CAB, instead of Network Support You have confirmed that:
The Network Support group record has the Group types: Incident and Change
The Network CAB group record has the Group type: Change
What could you do on the incident form, for the Assignment Group field, to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
From the book:
Once group types are assigned, use Dictionairy Overrides to specify Reference Qualifiers on the Assignment group fields for each task type.

Selected Answer: C
Leverage the group Type field and reference qualifiers to restrict assignment options only to include appropriate groups.

Selected Answer: C
correct

Selected Answer: C
correct

questions.question_text: What are some good practices for guiding your customers' use of Notifications? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
From the book:
Notifications Good practices:
- Go for under-notification vs. over-notification
- Guide and advise customers on what notifications they should be using
- Be aware if Marketing and Communications needs to approve the wording and format

Selected Answer: ABC
In what world is the SPAM-ing agreeable and solicited???? E is so wrong that I am beginning to rethink about why I paid you!

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC !!

Selected Answer: ABC
ITSM Implementation (Tokyo) ebook p296

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC is correct. Customer does not want to get too many email notifications.
ABC is correctt
A B C is correct

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC is correct.
There is no incident.itil role.
We dont want the customer to get too many email notifications. So E is not correct.

choices.E: When possible, maximize the quantity of email updates to customers
choices.D: Use incident.itil.role template as the master template to build all other ITSM templates
choices.C: Use templates to ensure consistency and ease of configuration
choices.B: Get input from Marketing department, regarding format of customer/caller facing notifications
choices.A: Make sure Notification requirements and test plans are in the project scope from the start
